title: 2004년 United States v. Ronald Snook 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: United States v. Ronald Snook. 판결일: 2004-04-23. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Ronald SNOOK, Defendant-Appellant
**판결일**: 2004-04-23
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Coffey, Evans, Rovner

## 변호인

Timothy J. Chapman (argued), Chicago, IL, for Plaintiff-Appellee., David J. Stetler, Jonathan M. Cyrluk (argued), Stetler & Duffy, Chicago, IL, for Defendanb-Appellant.

## 인용

- 366 F.3d 439

## 판결문 요약

366 F.3d 439
    UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee,v.Ronald SNOOK, Defendant-Appellant.
    No. 02-2304.
    United States Court of Appeals, Seventh Circuit.
    Argued January 7, 2003.
    Decided April 23, 2004.
    
      COPYRIGHT MATERIAL OMITTED Timothy J. Chapman (argued), Chicago, IL, for Plaintiff-Appellee.
      David J. Stetler, Jonathan M. Cyrluk (argued), Stetler & Duffy, Chicago, IL, for Defendant-Appellant.
      Before COFFEY, ROVNER, and EVANS, Circuit Judges.
      ILANA DIAMOND ROVNER, Circuit Judge.
    
    
      1
      A jury found Ronald Snook guilty of one count of conspiring to defraud the federal government by violating the Clean Water Act, 18 U.S.C. § 371, 33 U.S.C. §§ 1317(d) and 1319(c)(2)(A), and five counts of concealing material information regarding a matter within the jurisdiction of the federal government, 18 U.S.C. § 1001(a)(1). He was sentenced to concurrent terms of 21 months' imprisonment, concurrent terms of two years of supervised release, a $1,000 fine, and $600 in special assessments. On appeal he challenges two evidentiary rulings, allegedly improper statements by the prosecution during closing arguments, and a two-level increase in his offense level for abusing a position of trust, U.S.S.G. § 3B1.3. We affirm in all respects.
    
    
      2
      Between 1994 and 1997 Snook was the "Environmental Manager" at Clark Refining & Marketing, Inc., a petroleum refinery in Blue Island, Illin...
